summary: An immigrant Indian mother fights the Norwegian foster care system and legal machinery to win back custody of her children.

reviews.content: Stopping High-Octane Stopped Serious Funny Bollywood Horror Like WWE Royal Rumble 2011 Scream And Shout Hahahaha Aaaaah

It really touches the heart barring the drama.. and portrays an immigrants life in the true colour. Above all it highlights the interpersonal relationships in an Indian family.
I really wish the key villain, the husband has been brought to justice and properly punished. 
Also if only the Indian govt had added a financial bonus to Mrs Chatterjee to help take care of her 2 children!!

Story: Very biased narrative by someone who doesn't understand what makes Norway so special. It touches Indian way of thinking but completely misses Norway's way of thinking...and most importantly that the context was Norway's customs (not India's custom).
Acting: Rani M is a fantastic actress. But an incorrect narrative undermines her performance.

This movie is one of the most fantastic ever seen, it truly made me so emotional that I cried many times throughout this movie, it is fantastic and amazing, this movie truly deserves an Emmy, Oscar and every award, one of the most amazing movies of all time.
Best filmatized  true incredible story about a mother's courage.

To see a fairly good movie with a powerful message on cultural divide and corporate abuse of power on immigrant families be reviewed by critics so poorly is a testament to the hate Indian Films get. 

I hope that Rotten Tomatoes takes a closer look at the critics verification process and actually make changes to the critical scores this film has been given.
Excellent movie, superb performances, a must watch. Rani is Rani for a reason - what a top actress ❤️
Good movie, must watch.
It's  great movie, I don't no why critics are so harsh against it.
Superb! Must watch movie!
Good Movie. I would recommend
The movie was very interesting.  I enjoyed the role Rani M played.  A very dramatic and entertaining.  Based on true story.  It was bit intense but overall an excellent film. It’s a much watch movie.
Truly inspiring story and amazing acting by Rani. We need to make more women centric movies - there are a lot of unsung heroines in the world whose stories need to be told.

Powerful. Gripping. Uplifting
Loved it! With a dramatic storyline, sympathetic and highly identifiable characters, and a triumphant end, you can't help liking the film. Just the right kind of film to unwind with at the end of the day. Also, it's interesting how director Ashima Chibber has used all the Bollywood masala without letting it overpower the film. It has the stars, the songs and the one-liners that make you want to clap and whistle, but its feet remain firmly on the ground throughout as you follow the protagonist Debika Chatterjee in the fight of her life against a powerful foreign nation that thinks it can squash her like a fly. The dramatic maze into which Devika is plunged, the sense of claustrophobia, of the walls closing in around you, the hunt for the kids, the chase at one point, which I don't want to give away here, are all portrayed really well with a restraint that is unlike any Bollywood film, without being any less impactful. The acting is great. Rani Mukerji clearly gave everything to the role both as an actor and as a proud Bengali mom. She is fantastic. Also impressive is the way Anirban Bhattacharya managed to rise above all the cliches of his role of a bad husband to deliver a totally believable and even sympathetic rendition of man stuck in a bizarre situation trying to save whatever he can in his limited way, and sadly failing. Best of all were the evil social workers, played by Estonian actresses, who managed to steal the scene every time with their spiteful looks and sinister sideways glances that said it all! Hope we get to see a lot more of those two and their witch-like boss, also Estonian, in Indian cinema!

Absolutely absolutely amazing and a beautiful heart touching movie of a true story! Loved it!! And Rani Mukherjee you were so amazing!!! Extremely good acting and storyline based on a true story of a mother. Please watch it. It's emotional and does total justice to the mothers who have gone through this. Hats off to the director for bringing this topic and story into the community. Thanks so much. Hope this movie becomes an inspiration to all, including fathers children and mothers. Go Bollywood! This is what is required in this generation (like the olden days movies)! Meaningful and inspiring story line!

Summary: Amazing performance Rani and amazing movie!
Highly recommended to watch the movie. It's Based on a true story of A mother vs a nation . Good Feeling after show the movie.

Dear Rani, you are a legend for a reason, Rani Mukerji uplifts the story of a mother snatched by Norway authorities, such emotional real life drama is worth watching on big screen. Kudos to the team 🪬❤️

I thought it was over dramatic but looking into the reality after watching the movie, I understand their depiction of events and applaud their boldness. Great acting, important message, moving delivery.
Highly sensitive topic. Rani's acting is superb. Worth to watch it.

1- TRUE story
2- super acting 
3- proper casting 
4- background music 🎶 
5- super drama
So i feel it deserve more thn 80%
The world must see this movie. This is reality.

Excellent. Rani is excellent as usual. No surprise that the white people who review for this website would rate this at 10%. How dare those minority people portray the way they were treated by a white nation. This is Indian cinema, the culture and standards are different. Stop judging minority cultures with your culturally biased lens.
Mind blowing performance by Rani!

A well-written script of a real life, Norwegian government-sponsored tragedy of a mother, whose breastfeeding children were forecefully taken away.
The actors and crew are all fantastic in their performances. I hugged my 26-year-old son at the end of the film; just grateful that he's there.
Now Norway is answerable to the entire world for their practices and law that is bereft of any humanism.
Excellent screen play; a must watch family movie. We've been crying for content cinema for a while; don't miss this!

Mrs. Chatterjee vs. Norway is a film that is based on an inspiring, momentous story, which is also led by a remarkable central performance from Rani Mukerji, but it unfortunately collapses because of its script, which is not up to match, lack of character development and poor execution.

'Mrs. Chatterjee vs Norway' is a heart-wrenching and emotionally soaking drama anchored by Rani Mukerji's astounding performance.

Great acting, soundtrack, super accurate portrayal of the social services people and great real life story.

This movie is a must watch because it shows the real picture of what the social services in the nordic countries are doing with children of the immigrant families. As someone who lives in one of these countries, I myself know countless families who have had their children taken and never got to see them again. This movie should be supported so that more people can see what is going on in the nordic countries.

More of such movies should be made. I am pretty sure any negative reviews of this movie are sponsored by the nordic governments but if you go to watch this movie, you are in for a delight.
A not-to-miss movie, more hard hitting because it's based on real life. Superb acting by all, but outstanding performance by Jimmy Sarbh.
Rani is great.. awesome movie must warch
Very intriguing and emotional movie. A must watch.
It is an important movie for every Indian to watch.

This movie finally shows the world how children are being snatched and put with the wrong people against their wishes.
Well done Mrs Chatterjee for speaking up and thank you to the movie producer for giving hope to children who are trapped in this system . I hope people appreciate the message of this movie and world leaders put pressure against Europe to stop this child trafficking business.
It's a great movie. A must watch film with your family

A shameless movie, which not only goes ridicules a country's system but does it in a pathetic way. Just when regional cinema of the country starts to grow and make the country proud, the main stream Bollywood industry does this, truly shameless.
And my sincere apologies to the people of Norway.
Excellent momentum, heartfelt emotions and sincere acting makes this movie a must watch.

Mrs. Chatterjee vs Norway is a powerful and thought-provoking film that offers a unique perspective on immigration and family values. It is a must-watch for anyone interested in exploring these themes in depth, and its excellent performances and nuanced storytelling make it one of the standout films of the year. Rani aces her role as Mrs Chatterjee fighting against a whole nation for the custody of her children. It's a must watch
The first part was kind of a stretch, its was a average movie but I think overall the story was good.
